key_points: 70% of adult Americans are now fully vaccinated, up from less than one percent when President Biden took office.
Biden Administration announces details of two major COVID-19 vaccination policies to further increase vaccination rates.
OSHA requires employers with 100+ employees to ensure vaccination or weekly testing, paid time for vaccination, and masking for unvaccinated workers.
CMS mandates health care workers at Medicare and Medicaid participating facilities to be fully vaccinated.
The new policies aim to protect workers, prevent hospitalizations, save lives, and strengthen the economy.
The rules combined cover over 100 million workers in the United States.
Employers must comply with the OSHA and CMS requirements by January 4, 2022.
Vaccination mandates have increased vaccination rates by over 20 percentage points in participating organizations.
Economists unanimously agree that vaccination requirements will lead to a faster and stronger economic recovery.
The new rules preempt any inconsistent state or local laws that limit employers' authority to require vaccinations, masks, or testing.
